Based on your preference for love-themed films with intriguing plots, I'd recommend "Jumper" and "District 9".

"Jumper" is an action-adventure film about a young man with teleportation abilities who finds himself in the midst of an ancient war. The star-studded cast includes Hayden Christensen and Kristen Stewart.

On the other hand, "District 9" is a science fiction film that explores the complexities of humanity as extraterrestrial beings are forced to live in slum-like conditions on Earth. Sharlto Copley delivers an outstanding performance in this thought-provoking movie.

If you're looking for something more epic in scope, "The Odyssey" might be up your alley. This film features an ensemble cast including Vanessa L. Williams, Eric Roberts, and Bernadette Peters, retelling Homer's classic tale of adventure and survival.

Based on your interest in war genre films, I'd highly recommend "Taxi Driver" and "End of Watch".

"Taxi Driver" is a gritty exploration of one man's descent into darkness set against the backdrop of New York City's chaotic streets, starring Robert De Niro.

"End of Watch" follows two LA police officers navigating the city's dangerous criminal underworld, featuring compelling performances by Jake Gyllenhaal and Michael Peña. Both films provide a raw and intense look at the complexities of war - in this case, an urban warzone.

This film is set during World War II Germany and follows a young girl named Liesel who finds solace in books amidst the horrors of war. Another option is "The Imitation Game" (2014), which tells the inspiring story of Alan Turing, the English mathematician who tried to crack the German Enigma code during WWII, starring Benedict Cumberbatch. Both movies offer a unique take on the war genre and are certainly worth watching!
